channel.title: RSCD Question
channel.description:
Hey, i'm just thinking of looking and playing about with it on my localhost only problem is.. everytime i do somthing redirects to an ip address instead of localhost, which i thought would be simple goto admin panel then options and change base url.. But no not so simple
Bad HTTP_REFERER. If you have moved these forums from one location to another or switched domains, you need to update the Base URL manually in the database (look for o_base_url in the config table) and then clear the cache by deleting all .php files in the /cache directory.
That pops up, easy enough instructions sure, untill you find theirs no o_base_url in the config table.. Any suggestions?

item.title: RSCD Question
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

Clean the cache folder and set the o_base_url in the SQL DB.

Read full topic

item.title: RSCD Question
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

Thank you for standing up for me their bigh51, but i am pretty familiar with phpmyadmin and punbb, but never came across a cache_config.php before, and when somthing gives you instructions you’d expect them to be near enough correct lol, well thank you for the help anyways mate.

Read full topic

item.title: RSCD Question
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“infinative, post:3, topic:222170”]Please, do not even attempt to try with RSCD if you don’t know the basic functions, errors etc of Punbb or rscd source…[/quote]how would he know about punbb if he never has used it before? the answer is he wouldnt, thats why he needed help with punbb because he probably isnt familiar with php/mysql, but is with java.

Read full topic

item.title: RSCD Question
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Please, do not even attempt to try with RSCD if you don’t know the basic functions, errors etc of Punbb or rscd source…

Read full topic

item.title: RSCD Question
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

in the cache folder, edit cache_config.php and where it says o_base_url change the ip to localhost and it will work.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

Hey, i’m just thinking of looking and playing about with it on my localhost only problem is… everytime i do somthing redirects to an ip address instead of localhost, which i thought would be simple goto admin panel then options and change base url… But no not so simple

Bad HTTP_REFERER. If you have moved these forums from one location to another or switched domains, you need to update the Base URL manually in the database (look for o_base_url in the config table) and then clear the cache by deleting all .php files in the /cache directory.

That pops up, easy enough instructions sure, untill you find theirs no o_base_url in the config table… Any suggestions?
